document_name_accent: ung thu dai trang giai doan 2.json
document_title: Stage 2 colon cancer: Signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Colon cancer often has no signs in its early stages, only as the disease progresses does it cause more obvious symptoms. Stage 2 colon cancer symptoms may include:
Blood in stool;; Changes in the frequency or pattern of bowel movements, such as diarrhea, constipation, or narrow, rice-like stools; Stomach pain, cramps or bloating;; Nausea, vomiting;; Anemia (due to gastrointestinal bleeding);; Loss of appetite, loss of appetite;; Fatigue and weakness;; Unintentional weight loss;; Irregular menstrual cycle in women;; Bowel obstruction.
Abdominal pain, bloating, cramps, blood in stool... can be signs of stage 2 colon cancer.
